caption: Best spot in the neighborhood esp. for veg/vegan options.
The food is always well prepared and tasty, staff members provides awesome customer service. I loved the cleanliness and vibes. Highly recommended.
Wow. Some of most delicious food I’ve had in the past year. Every single item has been so fulfilling and tasty!!! Easily one of my favorite places in Brooklyn.
Couldn’t stop eating the paalak chaat, paneer was so soft and tasty, chicken tikka masala also delicious. Friendly service, excellent food + doing good work in the community.

Alhamdulillah, I have probably ate from one of the best places on earth. Their Chingri Malaikari is great and the Mango Lassi is one of a kind. Like really, ma shaa Allaah, I don't think any other restaurants can make mango lassis as does this one. Glad it is right next to my home.
Everything delicious. Some of the best dosas, chaat, and tikka I’ve had. Great price for great quality food.

Had ordered a take out from here. We had ordered chicken tikka masala, garlic naan and chicken biryani. The chicken tikka masala had a nice smoky flavor to it and the portion size was also good. The garlic naan were small 2 naans not very filling. The chicken biryani was not good at all. The chicken was boiled and mixed with flavored rice. The rice was also soft and sticky. They can improve big time on the biryani. They provided a mint chutney with it which was really nice. Overall the experience was okay.

Last night, based upon a neighborhood review, I went to Jalsa to order food for the first time.  They were very busy.  While I was waiting, two women with a child stood in the cold and asked if they had to pay for food.  I was dumbfounded. Restaurants are struggling in COVID times. I responded, “I think you have to pay for food but I’ll ask”.  The woman behind the counter took one look outside and said “I know her.  I’ll take care of her”.  It was such a beautiful random act of kindness to witness.  It became very clear to me that they serve the community regularly and even offer free food deliveries to the elderly.  Swooooooon!  This same woman gave me a free “sample” of Spinach Chaat. She said: “It’s best if you eat it fresh. Sit in your car and I’ll bring your food to you when it’s ready”.  I place “sample” in quotation marks because this “sample” was the equivalent of a full meal.  Words cannot describe how delicious it was. It’s not something I would have normally ordered on my own and I’m so grateful.  She didn’t know this, but at 8pm, her sample was my first meal of the day.  My full order was completely worth the wait!  Grilled chicken kebabs, grilled lamb chop, chicken kofta, chicken tikka masala, spinach saag, and rice.  Mmmmmm.  The spices and aromas were perfect!  I highly recommend, not only for the quality of their food but for their generosity, friendly demeanor and sense of community.  The staff of Jalsa sure knows how to warm a heart and belly on these cold winters nights!

DELICIOUS Fresh, clean food, vegan options, spiced and balanced; can tell the food is made with love in their hearts.  You can taste the difference!  We had 6 different vegan dishes, would have been enough for 4 people, thank you so much for making fresh veggie/vegan so special!!   Our hostess was helpful, lovely, welcoming - much appreciated:)
Nice food.  Pleasant service .  Food  prices are  a  little  high .

To celebrate the Madam VP Harris decided to order pickup and the reviews I read rang to be true. I’ve had vegan Indian food before elsewhere but I selected meat dishes this time. I must say the spices and the taste of this food is good!! Y’all did that!! Very tender and seasoned just right(not too spicy or salty)!! That GARLIC NAAN😍. The mango lassi was just a nice finisher to the meal. I felt so happy got the “itis”(food coma😂). Food was superb. Definitely worth the trip. Definitely will order again!!🥂👏🏽👏🏽

Went last week and the food was great. Besides that the food is delicious (though worth noting - it doesn’t come with rice so don’t forget to order sides). The owners are running donated food delivery to NYers in need and toys for the holidays. Will definitely be back!

Best Indian food I've had in a really long time. How do they get the paneer makhani so smokey and creamy? Really you can't go wrong with any of the dishes. Can't wait to go back and try the seasonal dishes (pumpkin!) and the chaats. Worth the trip if you're not in Ditmas Park.

I had heard the hype but was still very impressed with my first experience at Jalsa. We ordered takeout and had the eggplant chaat and chicken chaap, which I would do again without question. Both were delicious, and I’ve never had anything like it before. I look forward to coming back and trying the rest of the menu.

I'm incredibly disappointed by their service lately. Their portion sizes have gone done by A LOT. Not sure if you can tell by the photo, but that's their $11 takeout container -- one of their mains and look how tiny it is. They took 1.75 hours to get here too. Last time they skimped on their portion size as well. As much as we like the food, we're never ordering from here again.
The place is superb and spacious, the food was delightful and the rates were very affordable. quick, productive service and very friendly waiters. Will definitely recommend this restaurant.
The food is delicious. And the lady I spoke to on the phone was kind enough to help me fix the wrong order I had placed after I received it. Thank you.

I hate that there are 8000+ reviews here and it isn't five star. I've been visiting this Wurstkuche location for TEN YEARS now. It has seen me through my twenties, into my thirties; from being vegetarian and vegan to a full on carnivore... My go-to recommendation that if safe and satisfying is the vegetarian smoked apple sage sausage with double sauerkraut and a side of belgian fries with chipotle ketchup and pesto mayo.

Amazing north and south Indian food that is a step above the usual fair. How do I know? Our best friends are Indian and one if them is a serious amateur chef. We’ve eaten with them hundreds of times. I had decided I would never order Indian food out again, until now. Wow!

One of the best Indian food in New York..they almost have every Indian dishes and incredibly tasty.I love their artichoke Alu tikki..chicken tikka masala chicken biryani basically list is endless and thy  introduced kaathi roll with options of chicken and paneer kaathi roll incredible😋Thanks jalsa for feeding such an amazing food❤️
Be aware of what you get. My friend found something inside a gravy dish . Never will he odor from here again.

last night was our first time we came to that fine restaurant. But It is obviously not the last time. We had a good time with the courteous service, with the finest  food and wine and with the decent cost. We will absolutely visit there soon.

Howlin' Ray's is by far the most popular Nashville fried chicken place that I know of. This place never fails to attract customers. The lines are always long and can take hours until you reach the front because of how busy they are but it is definitely worth the wait. The chicken pieces are huge and the sando is amazing! The workers there are super friendly and provide excellent service! If you've never had Howlin' Ray's then I suggest you go because this is the best chicken you will ever eat in your life. Don't let the line intimidate you, be patient, it will all be worth it in the end.

LOVE LOVE LOVE Jalsa. They forgot to put in our garlic naan (truly no big deal - I live about a 3 min walk away). The owner apologized and had someone deliver it to our home! Truly great service and food. Get the paneer Nizami!
Absolutely excellent! We moved the the neighborhood not long ago and this is certainly a favorite spot. The vegetarian chatt is unreal love this place !
Everything here is delicious (especially Spinach Chaat, chicken tikka masala + gobi ka keema). I love this place!!!

Visited again recently for takeout (08/06/2020). Biriyani remains great! We also ordered Kadhai chicken and Nauseen gave us complementary Onion Kulcha. The Kadhai Chicken and Onion Kulcha were mind blowing. Will definitely recommend and try more of the new selection of breads (naan, kulcha, parathas etc.). They are doing take out due to Covid and it was totally worth it to go there and pick up the amazing food. ------ The most authentic Kolkata food in NYC. This is the only place that makes (Arsalan style) Kolkata biriyani, and yes, they come with potatoes. Also, the chicken chaap is a must try. Get some white rice to go with it. The paneer we got here was fresh home made and super soft. Overall this place was a gastronomical delight. Plus, the prices are low! Strongly recommend!
The food is incredible. All of the currys are delicious. Favorite Indian restaurant hands down.

The best Indian food in the neighborhood - creative interpretation of Sag Paneer that tastes a bit smoky and very creamy! Just the right amount of spiciness, they know their stuff. I keep coming back, such a treat during the lockdown. Yummy lamb - tender and juicy.
The food was INCREDIBLE. I’m so impressed and look forward to trying more things from their menu.

Possibly the best food in Ditmas Park! We always order the vegetarian paalak chaat can't be missed.  Also love the shahi yellow rice cooker in chicken broth and seasoned. And the samosas make a perfect late night snack.

Excellent food! Had the chicken jalfrezi and eggplant chaat, we’ll definitely be back. Pretty quick service - twenty minutes for pick up.  Also! Jalsa and the owner Nowshin, are currently serving the community providing food and supplies to neighbors in need due to COVID-19. So go order some delicious food to support them, or just donate!
Their food is delicious, we've always been very happy when we sit at the table with this food. Whatever you get, also get the Palak Chaat!

I ordered briyani from here I literally got 2 pieces of chicken for $10 that's not the only thing that got me mad I waited 45 minutes for my order and when I got it I went straight to my car and planned on eating it right away because I was starving and it was cold they put way to much of rose water in it I don't even understand what kind of restaurant this is Bangladeshi Indian or Pakistani because for any of those 3 cultures they did not get it right
Food is good but service is painfully slow. It makes the experience frustrating

Wonderful food!  I traveled in India for a year and have had many homecooked meals with my best Indian friend's family, so I like to think I have a good sense of good Indian food- and after my first delivery meal from Jalsa yesterday I am so happy to have a new place for excellent Indian food, at reasonable prices so close by, and with such friendly service!!  I am instantly become a regular and cannot wait for my next meal from them.  Having grown up in the neighborhood I can't believe I didnt know they existed till yesterday... but I will now make up for lost time!!  Hmm, what's for lunch?....
Love love love this place so much. The food is absolutely delicious and everyone is so kind.

This is a hidden gem! The best thing about them is that they make Paneer in-house which is a rarity for Indian restaurants. The food is amazingly delicious and the hostess is warm and friendly (Shoutout to Nausheen!). Hadn't eaten Indian food with authentic taste in these many days until a friend suggested this place and we checked it out. Had Papdi Chaat and Saag Paneer which reminded me of my days in Mumbai. Definitely going back to try more!

I don't know whats up with these people, but whenever i order (in store or delivery) they take well over two hours just to PREPARE the food. But time aside, the food uncooked to the point where they just decided to boil it for a couple of minutes. I mean come on, TWO HOURS YOU TOOK YOUR TIME. only reason i put a star is because the food somehow managed to show up before the end of the century...

Had a great experience. Great tasting food. Tried the dum bryani, grill chicken and lamb chops, shrimp mailaicari was really complimented with the dum chicken bryani. Had the belpuri , tasted great as a starter and lassi. Will go again.
Nice please good customer service food was very tasty we'll visit again

Came from Queens for some of the best Indian Food in NYC. There is great care take in preparing the food which one can tell are freshly made.  Coming from Indian heritage, I can attest to to the authenticity of the food. Well worth the travel for some excellent Indian food In this cozy restraunt.  Quality is great!

Absolutely amazing food. The lamb chops were to die for,  and the Paalak chat was unbelievable, I've never tasted anything like it (I almost didn't want to put that in the review so it never runs out!)
The food is great, outstanding customer service, Cousy atmosphere and setting, must try the ghost chicken!
Awesome food, great service and the atmosphere is just nice and relaxing. Definitely try out the Ghost Chicken and the mango lassi, both were beyond amazing.
(Translated by Google) WOOOOOW  (Original) WOOOOOW
Delicious food

First time here and it was such a pleasant experience. The decor is minimal yet cozy and elegant. The staff was nice and the owner took time to speak with us. Her pride in the food is well deserved. The mango lasso was the smoothest I've ever had. The chicken biryani was well balance with flavor and spice, and the shrimp in coconut milk was fresh and delicious. Even the naan was freshly made. I'm so happy to find such a great place in the neighbor. I'm looking forward to going back and trying out their other dishes. Also, the dishes the food came in the music they played really enhances the atmosphere. Just love it!
The food was amazing! The chicken biryani was out of this world, packed full of flavor! The mango lassi is the best I have ever had! I will definitely be coming back for more.
Finally I have a place to go to near me. Wonderful service, tasty and quite inexpensive. Decor is simple and clean, large vegan and meat menu. Definitely coming back.
Very - very tasty food, fresh, flavorful , amazing.  Perfect service. Just wow.... 👍👍👍♥️

Cute little restaurant with really good food. On their suggestion, I tried their Paneer Nizaam with Naan and I must say, I haven't tried anything like it. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, dipped in gravy. I haven't known Paneer made like this, but I'm glad I know now :)
The food was excellent! Every dish exceeded expectations by a quite a bit , and the owner was very nice nice an personable with great customer service.
Had awesome reading food

I’m trying to decide which was better the food or the people running the place because both were amazing.  First time eating here and we were so happy.  The owner was so nice and the food was delicious.  We will be back soon We ordered so much and everything was so tasty.  We have so much leftovers and so happy to eat it in the next day also.  So reasonable and happy we found this place randomly.

One of the best Indian food. Palak chat was delicious and addictive. The grill combo that I ordered was tender, juicy and well seasoned. It came on a sizzling plate with onion, pepper and cabbage. Chicken biryani  was aromatic and flavorful. Our server informed us that they add rose petals and saffron for the aroma in the biryani.  I highly recommend this restaurant.
The service was very good and the paneer was amazing. A must try!

Being a vegan from Turkey where everyone loves meat has never been easy so when I moved to New York, I was so excited to be in a city with so many other vegans and vegan restaurants! I have tried many vegan restaurants and based on my visit tonight, Jalsa's food is the most flavorful of them all. For my dinner I ordered saag alu (spinach with potatoes) and a wonderful medley of vegetables on a toasted bun called Pav Bhaji. The restaurant is informal and the entire staff is very friendly. From the number of deliveries I saw going out the door during my meal, I could tell they also do a brisk takeout/delivery business as well! Thank you Jalsa for a great dining experience I will be back soon!

I sincerely do not know where all these good reviews come from. Definitely not the best Indian in Brooklyn. I’ve had better Indian food in Ohio for gods sake. This place was dirty, their food was OK at best. Meat was dry, the food didn’t come with rice and the naan looked like it came out of a package. I felt like everything was just thrown together super fast in the kitchen. Maybe it just wasn’t for me. The only positive is that the people were very friendly. Wouldn’t recommend.
loved the food .. great price for quality .. the place is family owned, the owners are very friendly and the dishes are very tasty .. will definitely return.
Incredibly good vegan food!

I had chicken biryani and ghost chicken. If you looking for a quality dum biryani please visit this place! Amazing flavor. Ghost chicken was good but the chicken could have been fresh. Otherwise this restaurant is a must visit for Indian food lovers!

Best Indian food I've had in the states so far.  Really yummy.  Nice people, too, and clearly proud of their culture and happy to share their knowledge about food (and other things).  Totally worth it.
It was amazing best Indian food ever!!! Every one should go

Best food in New York City ..there palak chat was so delicious every single leaf had flavor and the every leaf was crispy.,server was so sweet and v welcoming.place is v small.so better reserve  in advance...they hv amazing options which includes Artichoke alu tikki chat,dahi puri ,palak chat,.whatever we ordered was so delicious and freshly made ..big fan of Jalsa ..🥰❤️See you soon

Amazing food! Paneer was soft and  delicious exactly how it should be! Found good indian restaurant in brooklyn loved the food and service..Nausheen is so sweet and made us feel comfortable and provided good service. Must go!
Authentic Indian food. I was told they make fresh dahi themselves, which I can tell from the mango lassi. Excellent service as well.

Probably the best Indian food I've ever had in my life. Very friendly staff who clearly take pride in their work. The dishes are interesting and absolutely delicious.  As a food lover (and very infrequent Google reviewer), it's been a long time I've gotten this excited about finding a new place to eat.
Delicious butter chicken. Just keep in mind gravies do not come with rice; order rice or naan separately.
Delicious meals made with care! The owner is friendly and her genuine care translates into some delicious food!

This place is fantastic. The staff is very friendly. The food is creative and tasty. I asked for some chilies and what do I get? some special Afghan achaar!  Jalsa feels like it is a part of the neighborhood, AND they have a bunch of vegan options AND they are not overpriced. Highly recommended.

I had a very good experience at this cute restaurant. The waitstaff is friendly and the service was pretty quick. My food which was shrimp dumplings and chicken biryani was very tasty. The place is a tad small, so it can't seem to accommodate large crowds. But overall, this restaurant is clean and the menu has a lot of good options, with very...and I do mean very reasonable prices. I will be back.
Delicious I’m so impressed with the food and flavors. The service is really nice too I would definitely go again and invite others!!
Best Chicken Biryani in Brooklyn

Just ordered food through doordash. The food is soooo good. We ordered paneer makhni, chicken tikka gravy and lamp chops. Also chaat papdhi. Everything was amazinggggg. There was a small misunderstanding about order but Nausheen was really sweet and sorted it out on phone. Definitely will be my favorite go to Indian place for ordering.
Both the food and service were great. Palak Chaat was great, a must try.
Food was so delicious service was gr8..highly recommended...
Superb. The originality, quality, and price are just excellent. Highly recommended!!
Great flavors. Everything tasted so unique and freshly made. The staff is friendly and seems happy to be there which is rare. Went for lunch and came back with my family for dinner.. wanted more. 👍👍👍
Love the food
Long wait for the food but we'll worth it.  Will definitely come again(maybe call ahead)
very nice place, lovely staff. Had a delicious lamb vindaloo and a goat curry. Really enjoyed the dinner. Will be back
Delicious food. Outstanding service. Will come back for sure.
Amazing place, excellent food !

I ordered vegetable samosa from this place. One of the samosa had a strand of hair in it. A part of that strand of hair was inside the samosa and half of it was dangling outside. I wonder how the cooks did not notice it and still fried the samosa. It was such a turn-off. Simply put,  just avoid this place.
Luckhnowi chicken is to die for!
Love the place cant wait to come back love the service and the people working there very friendly environment

Love that place, they're service is fast and awesome, I came all the way from ga and did a quick stop with my family, and it was great and the prices are very reasonable, love the lady nosheen who served us, cant wait to come back.
Very good Indian food. Authentic Indian taste !

I rarely write any online reviews but this place is too good to not say something about. The food here is incredible and the staff are some of the nicest people. The menu is very diverse and has lots of options I have never seen anywhere else.

Jalsa is a rarity in Indian/Pakastini cuisine in the US: the co-owners are creating new dishes that are deeply rooted in tradition and yet totally new. The result is simply stunning. It's a small local restaurant with out of this world flavors. The menu is small, and the quality very high. They even make their own paneer, everything is cooked fresh, to your order. This means that you have to be prepared to talk amongst yourselves while you wait for your food. There is nothing fast food here, it takes time to come to the table. And yet, it is well worth your time. I rated Jalsa as the best tasting subcontinent food I have had in North America.

Just returned home from dinner at Jalsa. It was so delicious! We had the Paalak Chaat (spinach chaat) and I will be going back frequently just to order that, it was so good! I also had the Gobi Mirchi Keema curry, which was minced cauliflower curry dish, which was also amazing. Both were fresh and delicious and were new flavors to me. My boyfriend had the ghost chicken which he gobbled up. Our servers were lovely, and taught us about the dishes and what regions they from and gave great recommendations. We learned they are doing a dosa brunch now from 9-3. They have several vegan and gluten free options on both menus.  The menu clearly states that they make everything from scratch and it may take a little time for your food, so plan accordingly. We didn't wait long at all in the restaurant, and were enjoying a night out anyways, but this is clearly not pre-made food that will show up 3 minutes after you order it.  I have not tried delivery, so cannot speak to that, but eating in the restaurant was charming and fun and food was piping hot! Will definitely be going back!

The neighborhood in which Jalsa is located (Little Pakistan) has been known for years for its low price, hole-in-the wall Pakistani & Bengali restaurants where cost has always superseded cleanliness and service. Jalsa, however, is much different!  First of all it is an Indian restaurant so the emphasis is on the spices. Indian food is much less oily than Pakistani and Bengali food and the flavors are thus more subtle and complex. Also they offer vegetarian and vegan options such as palak chaat, artichoke tiki masala and kale and spinach pagora which have attracted customers coming all the way from Manhattan!  Secondly it is a clean, informal restaurant where friendly service, reasonable prices and comfort are emphasized. The owner is on hand every day to be sure you enjoy your meal and is more than willing to honor special requests.  Third as of 6/23/19 they have added a South Indian brunch that includes amazing dosa and other breakfast foods!  Fourth Jalsa is one of the only places in all of New York City where you can order an authentic Indian chikoo shakes! If you’ve never had one, it’s made from an Indian fruit. It tastes a little like a vanilla milkshake and trust me a chikoo shake is not only healthy but incredibly delicious! (see photo posted below)  Finally the demographics of Parkville, the neighborhood in which Jalsa is located, are changing and as a result, Jalsa meets the need for those new to the area who are looking for a clean, informal and friendly restaurant at which to relax and enjoy some very well made Indian food.
Such friendly, relaxed service,  as if we were in someone's home. Symphonies of flavors exploded in our mouths from each dish Spinach chaat - SO good.  Best veggie Biryani we had tasted.

Finding a  restaurant with a wide selection of authentic Indian vegan dishes at reasonable prices is a challenge but it is one that this little restaurant meets with grace, charm and incredibly delicious food!  Jalsa is located in Brooklyn on Coney Island Avenue between Newkirk and 18th Avenues. It is clean and nicely decorated with a comfortable , friendly atmosphere. The very friendly and helpful owner is always there to be sure you order exactly what you want. Her staff is likewise committed to being sure you enjoy your visit!  I learned that they cook their vegan dishes in separate pots to avoid cross contamination with their meat and poultry entrees and that their chef is a vegetarian and a certified Bikrim yoga instructor!  We have eaten at the restaurant and also ordered from here online (free local delivery) and every time we have, the food has arrived on time and warm!  An Indian restaurant where people from India come to eat says it all!  Update 6/10/19 A new menu that includes Palak Chaat (spinach), Chikoo Shakes (amazing flavor and hard to find in NYC) and I heard they are starting to have dosa in the mornings. They really are the best Indian restaurant in Brooklyn!
Just had lunch here, great chicken tikka masala, mango drink, naan bread, and Indian fried bread. Service is really great, friendly and speedy.

The most delicious chicken masala I've ever had by far. Very nice ambiance enhanced by the very friendly owners. They make an amazing creamy mango drink I recommend to everybody. I highly recommend Jalsa without any hesitation

Absolutely delicious! Im glad that my friend recommended this place. It’s new and is undoubtedly the best Indian restaurant in Brooklyn. The menu is unique. Artichoke Alu tikki Chaat was out of the world. They recommended spinach Chaat too - which I’m going to try on my next visit. Chicken biryani had an aroma which unlocks your appetite instantly. Their Chicken tikka Masala is the best among the ones I tried in town. I wanted to order more but I was sooooo full. Waiting to come back again and try other items.
Jalsa was delicious! The food and service were wonderful! For anyone who is sensitive to spice, each dish is prepared to order so you can adjust the heat. Great for eating in or getting delivery!
Food was okay. It took very long to come. Very sweet people though

First time trying out food from this Restaurant. It was delightful and delicious. A very family friendly environment with calming decor. Kind a respectful owners who take pride in their culture and food. I will definitely come back for more.
It was an amazing experience and different from other Indo/pak restaurants and food quality was superb. The presentation was also great. I definitely recommend this place to everyone.
Great food with plenty flavor. I must go back.
There lamb chops are on point , juicey and flavorful. There bhelpuri hit the spot. Ask for there specials, the have specials that are not in there menu.

Sometimes it's the little things that conspire to make a dish unforgettable. The aggressive toasting of pungent mustard seeds; the char on singed red chile pods; the faint blackening of curry leaves flash-fried to a brittle, translucent crisp. All these smoky subtleties come together in the magnificent Jalsa, a quietly sophisticated spot tucked away in Brooklyn's Coney island  neighborhood. Fascinating and complex, the shish kabab was the best  dish I had tried in ages. I was similarly impressed on another visit, when a weekend special of housemade lamb seekh kebab came forth from the tandoor as delicate, loose-textured lamb  alive with onion and herbs, magenta pickled onion crescents delivering a final kick. The world Jalsa has fashioned on Coney island avebue  exudes the calm confidence of there cooking. It's the dining room of a man who knows how to edit and knows his own mind. Jalsa menu and operational rules reflect the same qualities.  There are no "degree of hotness" options, because Jalsa wants to let each dish express its best self, with its own innate balance. Rice plate is perfect, each grain of basmati distinct, with saffron threads tinting some and tinges of love. above all the waiters and the owners will take your order with love, they have the best patience. I can't wait to try there next dishes and review them.  As for the parking part, of you wait a bit there's always someone leaving ( remember; patience has great rewards).
Everything was so delicious, from the spinach chaat to the butter chicken! A real treat in the neighborhood!

I've been standing here waiting for an order to go for 30 minutes and the lady in charge (and the only staff member around) is very rude and doesn't really care that me and others waiting are visibly upset. very unprofessional. I wouldn't recommend it to my worst enemy.
the food is good the time  it comes is it 2 hours later

The Food is delicious! The best Indian I've had since living in Thailand two years ago. Trust me, l am a "foodie" with a discerning palate; the food is very flavorful, clean and the service is superb! I can highly recommend the Lamb Tikki, it was succulent, tender and sizzling. The chicken Tikki Masala, is delicious! I'd give 10 stars if l could, authentic Indian food, A+++
I have orders couple of times, mostly veg curries. Its awesome.

Incredible family style restaurant. The reviews are not wrong, the food tastes like what you would expect from a family home. Flavorful, unique and well portioned one cannot go wrong visiting this restaurant. Highly recommend the waiter or waitress recommendation for the day. That said, consider the eggplant chana chaat dish and any of the paneer dishes. Dishes are incredibly reasonable in terms of pricing.  Staff was responsive and kind. The decor is humble. The fish tank is a bit of an oddity. All in all, this is the type of restaurant you root for, the one you want to see succeed.
Food is excellent

The food was okay, but the main issue is that the food was delivered three hours late. I called after it was an hour late,  when I was told the order had never been made, and then again after another hour. They didn't rush the order or ever offer to comp us the charge. The restaurant is only 15 minutes from our house, so after the first call when they said it would take 10 minutes to make, there was no reason for it to take another 2 hours to have it arrive. They apologized, but at that point they had already lost a customer. It would have been much simpler for them to have refunded us and maybe we wouldn't have been so annoyed.

Wow one of the best Indian food I ever had .the place is not big but thy hv tremendous potential to grow ..how thy blend Indian food it’s really remarkable.we visited there last week with my friends and we ordered spinach chat ,lamb chops ,chicken chops,Gobi mirchi ka keema which is mince cauliflower Chicken tikki masaale and ther yellow rice and Naan .food was fresh and amazingly flavorful.i never had palak chat in my life as I hv visited many Indian restaurant it’s crispy spinach with sweet and tangy sauces and spices,i love how every spices and sauces was blend and u can actually taste each of them .lamb chops wasbest in New York I ever had very juicy and tender with right amount of spices.and other food equally good .highly recommended .must visit place.
Food was average, atmosphere was a bit depressing, tried ordering a few different items but they weren't available, it was my first time but will.be back to try them again

I'm confused about the good reviews on this place. Went there yesterday for dinner. There were 5 of us and we had appetizers, bread/nan and a variety of different entrees. Food was just "ok" and some tasted burnt and overcooked and some lukewarm or cold. So disappointed because I heard such great things and was excited to go there. Only good thing is the super friendly staff .. I really really wanted to like this place because I  WAS SO excited to have another Indian restaurant in the neighborhood that I live in.  I don't know what kind of weird spices or seasoning they used I was very different than any other Indian food that I have had. Give it a miss

Jalsa is one of the best restaurants I’ve ever been to! Each dish is so flavorful, fresh, and made with care, yet it is affordably priced. I especially recommend the spinach chaat. The owners and staff are all friendly. Go to this place soon, before it gets famous and you have to wait in long lines!

I loved the food here! The owner was extremely nice and really cared for us. Had conversation letting us know about her next new menu and trying to provide everyone here a new and unique experience. Would highly recommend this spot!
Worth of trying!
Chicken tikka was insanely good. Such reasonable prices and food so so good. Great addition to the neighborhood!

Let's first off and say I was skeptical of all the great reviews and decided to try it out myself since I was in the neighborhood. Upon entry, it's a small compact type of space for the restaurant. It has a home type feeling with the entire staff greeting you.  I had the Lamb Tikka Masala and my other half had Shrimp Yogurt Curry. Wait time is usually longer than other similar restaurant which I estimated 25+ mins until my meal arrived.  I must say it was worth the wait. It was extremely delicious with the aroma of home cooking stimulating my senses. The Naan and Yellow Rice Sahri (think it's called) complimented our Curry dishes and we both ate our entire meal.  My other half ordered both dishes as spicy but for me...nothing I came across that's too spicy since I been use to it as a kid. But the extra spiciness caught her off guard LOL  We were greeted by the owner(s) and one of them noticed my other half was breathing fire 🔥. Then the next course of action which I took notice and saw a really kind gesture from management.  The guy brought her Rasmali with extra milk to help sooth the spicy food she ate which I find incredibly admirable and sincere. Things like this what makes or break a restaurant and warranted my positive review with great food and sincerity. I am for sure coming back again to try other dishes. Thank you for the warm hospitality!  Bonus Note: Food is Halal 🥰
There’s a reason this place has a 5 star average rating. Go here and find out. Homemade yogurt to homemade cottage cheese, everything freshly cooked grilled fried and baked. You will not regret it!
Absolutely delicious! So lucky to have this gem in the Ditmas Park/Kensington area. Favorite dishes include paneer nizami, biryani and butter chicken.
Place was clean and they make a food from scratch and waiting was worth
Awesome food. Tried chicken biryani and lamb chops.  Lamb was juicy and soft and biryani was full of flavors. Also the owners nice people and very good customer service.
username: ANAS ABDUL QUADER BIN ATEEF AL JABRI

caption: The food is very tasty and delicious. Would definitely recommend to family and friends.
First time eating Indian food and it was amazing😋' the staff was polite and helpful on helping me order. I would recommend the chicken tikka masala. Great job to the staff of Jalsa-grill&gravy.
Great restaurant, warm people and the food is amazing!  I’ll be coming here on a weekly basis!

Excellent food and service. I highly recommend it. I will definitely be back. They have traditional (Indian, Pakistani, Afghani and Bangladeshi Cuisines) I had Jalsa cater my Christmas party and everybody loved it

just had a fantastic dinner at Jalsa. it was because of their okra. and their pumpkin curry. and their spinach. let me rave... Jalsa makes the BEST OKRA YOU'VE EVER had. it's smoky. it's smooth. it's umami. it's got a little red onion. i never knew okra could be so good! and GOD BLESS the PUMPKIN CURRY. i had it for the second time tonight, and it was better than the first. the owner says they use only the freshest ingredients and it shows. eat here and you'll be satisfied.

A friend of mine (way into Indian/Pakistani food) told me about this place. He wanted to check it out and see if the hype was warranted.  I cheated and went first on my own. I ordered Chicken Tikka Masala. It was out of this world. Deep, rich flavors I’ve never tasted before. Then I went back the next day with my friend. We ordered a few things. All of them equally impressive. The ingredients were fresh and the spices crazy good. On top of that, the woman who runs the place could not have been nicer. I also met her husband, who was equally charming. It’s worth a trip to the neighborhood. Or having delivery if you live in Ditmas or Kensington.
This place is so good. One of two places in NYC that is as good as south Asian food in the U.K.

Go try this place for the biryani, keep coming back for everything else.  I went to this place with my friends in search of some legit Bengali food. Bengal is a state in Eastern India that lies adjacent to(and was erstwhile a part of) Bangladesh. The food of this region is dominated by influences of Islamic regimes (biriyani, chaap etc) and an abundance of water resources (malaikari, paturi etc). The food, if you do indeed try the Bengali dishes, should taste reminiscent of a lot of the stereotypical Indian fare, but still distinctly different with sometimes finer flavors, sweeter and more aromatic, and sometimes a culinary gut-punch of wasabi-esque gravy of mustard. Be prepared to be surprised and exhilarated.  We ordered the biriyani(biryani) of course. It is a medley of rice cooked with intense aromas of spices, meat, saffron and the humble potato. The inclusion of the potato along with the finer and sweeter flavor undertones define the biriyani of this region. Having ancient Persian roots, if you want the truest and more pure rendition of the Bengali variant in the entire tri-state area, this place is a must-go.  Amazingly, the stellar biriyani was given a run for it's money during my meal by the chicken chaap. This is an opulent and aromatic chicken gravy made from heavily reduced and perfectly softened pieces of chicken legs. Although a great accompaniment of the biryani, this dish truly shines on its own if you try it with white rice. Do not get apprehensive on seeing the fat and oil that separates in the gravy. Anything that tastes this good deserves an extra gym run.  We also ordered the paneer nizami and naan. To be honest these were supposed to be just fillers to stand as gastronomic back-ups to the meaty encores. As a pleasant surprise, the paneer was the most fresh and tender I have had in a long time. The dish stuffs the paneer with filling and cooks it in a thick creamy gravy. The soft naan made for the perfect foil. Again, perfection!  It is not always that you walk out of a restaurant ruing the wait till you come back again. This was one of those for me and my friends. The food was exquisite. The service was brilliant. The owner is very friendly and chats with customers. All of her recommendations from the menu were hits. She also offered us complementary appetizer chickpeas and taster shots of mango lassi. Oh yes.. the mango lassi. We ended up buying entire glasses each because it was so good with the food.  Now, a message to the restaurant owners, I really appreciate the earnest attempt to reach out to so many people who might not know about these special and amazingly tasty cuisines. I thank you for not compromising on the true tastes and flavors that hallmark the food. Thank you and best of luck.
Great taste and wonderful ,awesome
The food was perfectly Cooked... very good... Keep it up..
Fresh and not too greasy. You should go here & bring your friends.

Honestly might very well be the best Indian food I have had in New York. Extremely welcoming staff with appetizers to try and chicken Tika and spinach dish were delicious. Definitely will be returning!
Nice food

My husband, son and I went just now. I had the chicken tikka masala, my husband had lamb chops and my son had a  burger with fries. The food was excellent. The tikka masala tastes home made, this is very authentic food. Great prices and great taste. The staff is very friendly.

I highly recommend jalsa grill for lamb chops .happy to finally find the real lamb ribs as contrasted with other places offering cheap lamb pieces in lamb chops .The meat was this quality,it surely is one of the besu restaurant in neighborhood 😋😋😋
my favorite is gobi michi kenema and chicken tikka masala. my family's favorite restaurant

Haha, so I'm embarrassed to admit that my fiance and I ate there a week ago. And then came back last night.  My fiance is vegan and I'm a dairy-intolerant vegetarian, and we live nearby. It's really hard to find vegan/veg-friendly south asian cuisine in this area, actually. Most places don't separate the cooking areas of meat vs veg&vegan and avoiding cross-contamination is important to us. Then we heard the news of Jalsa's opening, and Indian restaurant with several options. Finally!! :D  So last week, we dined in and had the vegan plantain kofta, and OMG that sauce is dreamy and the kofta is so on point with the texture!! We also had the vegan bhel puri which to me is the perfect flavor blend of spicy, sweet, tangy, savory, salty, and with a nice crispy texture. :) The biryani is also very nice!!!  Then we came back last night and got the same stuff. Haha. We were craving it hard ever since having some. :D  The restaurant is very new, and they are still underway with fixing it up and redecorating everything. So just keep in mind that they literally just opened. But personally, I like that it's simple inside -- a bare bones place with a focus on getting that flavor right.  And that they do. :)

OMG - what amazing food. This is the result of a caring chef who comes and talks to you, and smiles and agrees to almost every request of yours. We were skeptical that all 5 star reviews were fake but there are still genuine people in the world and these guys are one of them. Definitely try their paneer Tikka. It was out of the world and the best we’ve ever had. But of course all 4 dishes we ordered were amazing. Keep it up, guys! Unfortunately we are from Boston and won’t get to come here everyday. Sigh :(

This place really is a hidden jewel that has lots of potential. I am an international student from India who has only lived a few years in the USA and ever since, I have been craving for Indian food. I tried many Indian, Pakistani and Bangladeshi restaurants in Manhattan, Brooklyn (in the same neighborhood) And even in New Jersey but it was never the same taste as my home country. The places always lacked flavor and everything was too generic. BUT THIS PLACE WAS AN ANSWER TO MY CRY!!! The FOOD IS EXACTLY HOW INDIAN FOOD SHOULD TASTE LIKE! I tried the Dum Biryani, Butter Chicken and Rice. The food had so much flavor and taste. It was hygienic and less oily than other Pakistani restaurants around the neighborhood. It was exactly how I wanted my Indian food to taste like and the spices are perfect despite it not being too chilly or spicy!!! Hence it is enjoyable to the American customer as well. The ambience is great. The owner is a nice Indian lady who is trying to do something different. I tried her vegan chickpea salad that was so innovative and creative, it was a fusion of Indian and western vegan taste that I absolutely fell in love with!!! I just really hope that things work out for this place and more people come! They also offer Chicken Chaap which I HAVE NEVER FOUND ANYWHERE IN THE USA!!! And I hope they continue to introduce chaap and create a demand for it because chaap is loved by all Indians! The place is cozy, clean and nice. All of this for such an affordable price!! (Price is similar to the restaurants around the area that are not clean or taste as good as this one!!!) I really hope this restaurant becomes successful because this is real, authentic Indian food cooked here and this is coming from an Indian person who just arrived to the USA.

I found this place, randomly and didn't know it was there. I'm so glad I checked this out with my friend and enjoyed the food they made. Loved the atmosphere, loved the bowl that came with the food, and the food it self was very good. If you're not into spicy food you'll enjoy it with no problems. If you love spicy food, like me, you'll still enjoy the different spices that was put into the food that give it the taste that wants you to eat more. I'm sure you can request the food to be spicy. Overall it's a great place for indian food!
The food taste is awesome, good prices and very nice food presentation. The ambience is clean and pleasant. A must go place if you are looking for good quality and tasty Halal desi food.

I was looking for a good place for desi food, specially biryani. The biryani was amazing and lamb chops were delicious. The service was excellent, they were friendly and fast. I would highly recommend anyone to try out this place. Good food at affordable price.
Best fries and there is not alot chicken samosa around but this place has .
Friendly server. Lamb was very juicy. Still working on decor, will come back soon.
Awesome real Indian food 😋 love it 😍

10 on 10 food is perfect we ordered jalsa dum biryani and Chicken tikka boti with lamb chops combination..everything was so tender and juicy..my vegan friend order daal of the day and spinach  and he loved  it too ..ambiance is v classy and upscale but food prices as compare to taste and freshness and service is v low..best restaurant in this neighborhood
The food is delicious, very good environment excellent service I recommend the Mango lassi chicken tikka yummy in my tummy and tender lamb chops w. Shahi rice was awesome.
Amazing food  and v nice service
Food was amazing spicially I like there tondoori lamb chop and kabab service is excellent owner is very friendly I specially recommended this Indian restaurant food is fresh and healthy
The Bihari Kabab is delicious! I definitely recommend this restaurant.

First time I had food which has  amazing flavors and taste ..it’s newly opened restaurant still thy are finishing ther decor,I went with my friends on Saturday night we were confused wethr thy are open or not as there were no sign of open ..and it was empty..but when you look from outside place looks v fancy  and upscale which is very rare in Coney Island Avenue..we ordered Jalsa Dum Biryani and chicken chap with shahi rice,complimentry thy gave us chicken tikka and Mango Lassi ..everything was 10 on 10...I never tasted so amazing food in my life in New York ..
